input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
Specific file for which to retrieve information.

The format of the resulting file list. Valid values: For Linux/Solaris. COLUMNS (multi-column output with entries sorted down the columns) LONG (long format output listing mode For a Windows O/S. BARE (Uses bare format - no heading information or summary) WIDE (Uses wide list format)

The file attribute used to sort the resulting file list. Valid values: For Linux/Solaris. NAME For a Windows O/S OWNER (owner of the files displayed) LAST MODIFIED (displays files in timefield order of last written) ACCESS TIME (displays files in timefield order of last accessed)

Filter method to use on the output returned. Valid values: For Linux/Solaris. DEFAULT (No Entry) (lists files and directories that do not begin with a dot (.)) ALL (lists all entries) NO PARENT OR WORKING DIR (Do not list Parent or Working Directories) For a Windows O/S. DEFAULT (No Entry) (displays the contents of the specified directory) ALL (displays all hidden files and directories)
Reverse the order of sorting? Valid values: true Applies to all OS.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true
